DOC.brief_summary: The study aim improve obstetrical care manage gestational weight gain ( GWG ) among high risk woman effort reduce maternal fetal complication .
DOC.detailed_description: The project aim teach woman appropriate weight gain pregnancy optimize health outcome mother newborn baby . Obese gravida meeting inclusion criterion none exclusion criterion offer enrollment TAGG . Those consent randomize receive standard care enhance care regard gestational weight gain . The primary outcome proportion patient gain less 20 lbs course pregnancy . Secondary outcome include patient knowledge expectation , attitude pregnancy weight gain , self-efficacy ability eat healthy , eating , sleep physical activity behavior , perceive stress , psychological factor , patient-experience , involvement care , food security .
DOC.criteria: Prepregnancy body mass index least 30 kg/m2 ( per patient report weight ) Less 16 week gestation Gestational weight gain ( GWG ) less < 11 pound prepregnancy weight time potential study enrollment Singleton gestation Access phone BMI le 30 kg/m2 Gestational age great equal 16 week Active diagnosis cancer electronic health record problem list Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) Palliative medicine patient Multiple gestation GWG excess 11 pound prior study enrollment Patients NonGeisinger prenatal care provider Vegan diet Malabsorptive condition Previously enrol TAGG prior pregnancy . Patient exclude rerandomization
